blog.name: geekyfeminist-love
blog.title: I'm just here to geek out—quasi hiatus
blog.description: A place dedicated to geeking out about my various interests. Erudite discussion and complete silliness are both welcome. My love for Daenerys Targaryen is deep, abiding, and unconditional but retired from GoT/ASOIAF fandom.

summary: do you ship arya and jon like romantically
question: do you ship arya and jon like romantically
answer:
This is a source blog that posts all content for Arya and Jon. 

If you’re curious as to what pairing each of our members ship, I suggest asking them on their individual blogs.

-Chaitali

summary: Robb: Good morning. Sansa: Good morning. Bran: Good morning. Rickon: You all sound like robots, “good morning, good morning,”...
body:
Robb: Good morning.

Sansa: Good morning.

blog.name: she-wolf-of-highgarden
blog.title: They Danced Through The Day And Into The Night
blog.description: 23/grad student/book nerd/ lover of arya stark/ Meera Reed defender/ searching for Edric Dayne/ mainly Jonrya and Gendrya

tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
summary: I do not get all of the “Arya is going to be Sansa’s guard posts”. Like what? When did Arya Stark say she ever wanted to be...
body:
I do not get all of the “Arya is going to be Sansa’s guard posts”. Like what? When did Arya Stark say she ever wanted to be someone’s guard? Her list of what she wanted to be when she grew up was: King’s Councillor, Castle Builder, and High Septon [Eddard V]

None of those things are guards or knights. Let’s say Sansa does become QiTN and since she has spent so much time South decides to put a small council in place. I could see Arya having a place on that. She would make a great Mistress of Whispers or as some kind of intermediary between Sansa and the small-folk. 

Why does she have to be reduced to muscle when she had higher aspirations for herself?

I could see Arya having a place on that. She would make a great Mistress of Whispers or as some kind of intermediary between Sansa and the small-folk.

I could see Arya having a place on that. She would make a great Mistress of Whispers or as some kind of intermediary between Sansa and the small-folk.

blog.name: annegal
blog.title: One Gal's Blog
blog.description: I am many things: comic book reader, television watcher, fan fiction enthusiast, sansan shipper, movie buff and all around geek.

summary: Who Will Win the Game of Thrones?
title: Who Will Win the Game of Thrones?
body:
There are many articles being written lately about which character will be sitting on the Iron Throne at the end of the final season of Game of Thrones.

The most common opinion seems to be that either Daenerys Targaryen or Jon Snow will emerge victorious as the ruler of Westeros. This is the most obvious outcome. Others opinions are that it will be Gendry Waters, Sansa Stark or even Tyrion Lannister who will rule Westeros. George RR Martin only promises that the ending will be bittersweet meaning that there will be victories but no one will end up completely happy.

I think Daenerys will make it to the end of the story, but I think her fate is tied with her dragons rather than Jon or anyone else. If the dragons perish, she will die with her children. If the dragons defeat the Night King and his ice dragon and live, then she might be the Queen of Westeros and rule as the Dragon Queen. I think more likely she will die a heroic death. If she does have a child with Jon, this child might live to rule Westeros but with someone else as a regent.

Jon Snow sitting on the Iron Throne might be a possibility. The War of the Roses on which this story is based ended with Henry VII on the throne. He was a distant cousin of the Lancaster family and his ancestors were the illegitimate children of Owen Tudor and Catherine, Henry V’s widow. Henry VII’s marriage to York heiress Elizabeth ended the war. So Jon could be the outsider who claims the seven kingdoms as his own. After all, his mother was a Stark and his father was a Targaryen and the romance of his parents cast a long shadow over the story.

Of course this argument could be used for Gendry. After all he is the son of the late king. I don’t think that Gendry will end up on the Iron Throne, but I do think he will be the heir to the Crownlands.

Sam will make it to the end and possibly marry Gilly. Ok, that is what I dearly wish. Same deserves a win and I like them together. I see her as lady of Horn Hill. He will be there to be to write it all down. Perhaps he will be the hand of the next king. 

I have no guesses as to Bran Stark’s fate. I do not think that he will ever walk again nor be the Lord of Winterfell. It would be interesting to have a scene between him and Jaime. 

Sansa’s fate is a bit if mystery. The way she has presented in the story as a Katherine of York figure whose marriage might prove the political alliance to end the war. At the end of Feast of Crows she is still in the Vale and there was no horrific marriage to Ramsey Bolton. Nevertheless, in the published chapter of Winds of Winter, Littlefinger is pimping her out to Harry the Heir who does not appear in the series. In the books Ramsey marries and mistreats a minor character named Jeyne Poole who he thinks is Arya Stark. On the show Sansa has become the Lady of Winterfell and as an important heiress she will marry again to form an alliance but who would she marry? The poor girl has been engaged and married off twice. On possibility is Gendry, Jon is another, or she might go back to her first husband Tyrion. In the original outline for the books, the role of the romantic object of desire is actually Arya as Jon and Tyrion become rivals for her love but this role is now taken by Daenerys.  So I don’t think Sansa will marry Jon, Gendry or Tyrion. Sansa ending up in a relationship with the Hound is a possibility. This is hinted at in the books and this pairing has a considerable fandom. In the books Sansa and the Hound are deeply attracted to each other and he is never far from Sansa’s thoughts. If Sansa is a warg and Martin suggested that all the Stark children are wargs, The Hound is the person Sansa might be able to connect to. Unfortunately, the show runners have sidestepped that entire subplot and I am guessing that this might not happen on the show. My best guess is that Sansa will stay at Winterfell and remain its lady. They might leave the Hound with her as a protector but they won’t do a romance between them. That said the Winterfell she will preside over will be in ruin.

It goes without saying that The Hound will win Clegane Bowl. There will be riot in the streets if this does not happen. But he might take some pity on his brother when he realizes that Gregor was made into a monster by Cersei’s henchman Qyburn. That would be an interesting plot twist.

I heard about a story leak that there was a scene filmed where the Hound is driving a wagon out of Winterfell and Sansa and Arya are with them. Are they escaping the armies of the Night King? I guess we will have to wait to find out if this report is accurate.  This is a bit of wishful thinking bit for my fellow Sansan fans.

 Arya is a question. George RR Martin’s wife made him promise not to kill Arya off. I think Arya will remain alone and a warrior, but it might be that she has to pay for time with the faceless men. She might also defeat them. In the original outline, Martin planned to have Arya lose her taste for vengeance and eventually be with Jon when she realizes that he is not her brother. In my own fanfiction, I have Arya as the maiden aunt to Sansa and Sandor’s children but that is wishful thinking on my part.

I am convinced that Cersei and Jaime are doomed to die together as prophesized. Cersei is based on Margaret of Anjou the Lancaster Queen who after losing both her husband and son in battle, was defeated by the House of York. She spent the last few years of her life living as a poor relation in the French court and died in penury. That would be my choice for Cersei but I think she will die. Qyburn do some sorcery to make her pregnant and if this so, it might be the means of her death.

I think that Tyrion will survive but I think his fate will be bittersweet. He will never win Daenerys’ love nor will be reunited with Sansa. He might betray Jon over Daenerys or to be reunited with his brother. He might take over his family’s fortunes but I suspect he will be alone at the end.

The casts has hinted that there will be many deaths during season eight and many battles. Martin mentioned that the story will end with a Game of Thrones version of the “Scouring of the Shire” which means there will be destruction and battles. I think the show will be more action driven rather than character driven as there are only six episodes and there will not be time to flesh out character driven subplots. I am guessing that most of the minor characters are doomed.

Euron Greyjoy and Theon Greyjoy will most likely die as will most minor characters. They are doomed and rather expendable. We have already seen the end of the Martells and the Tyrells as their part in the story has ended. Melisandre is going to die realizing that all she believed in will not happen. 

Yara Greyjoy might live long enough to rule the Iron Islands which would my choice for that character.

With Daenerys as Queen of Westeros and Sansa in charge of the North and Yara Greyjoy in charge of the Iron Islands … wouldn’t it be interesting if most of the rulers of Westeros turn out to be women?

I guess we will just have to wait to find out.

If Sansa is a warg and Martin suggested that all the Stark children are wargs, The Hound is the person Sansa might be able to connect to. Unfortunately, the show runners have sidestepped that entire subplot and I am guessing that this might not happen on the show. My best guess is that Sansa will stay at Winterfell and remain its lady. They might leave the Hound with her as a protector but they won’t do a romance between them. That said the Winterfell she will preside over will be in ruin.

It goes without saying that The Hound will win Clegane Bowl. There will be riot in the streets if this does not happen. But he might take some pity on his brother when he realizes that Gregor was made into a monster by Cersei’s henchman Qyburn. That would be an interesting plot twist.

I heard about a story leak that there was a scene filmed where the Hound is driving a wagon out of Winterfell and Sansa and Arya are with them. Are they escaping the armies of the Night King? I guess we will have to wait to find out if this report is accurate.  This is a bit of wishful thinking bit for my fellow Sansan fans.

 Arya is a question. George RR Martin’s wife made him promise not to kill Arya off. I think Arya will remain alone and a warrior, but it might be that she has to pay for time with the faceless men. She might also defeat them. In the original outline, Martin planned to have Arya lose her taste for vengeance and eventually be with Jon when she realizes that he is not her brother. In my own fanfiction, I have Arya as the maiden aunt to Sansa and Sandor’s children but that is wishful thinking on my part.

I am convinced that Cersei and Jaime are doomed to die together as prophesized. Cersei is based on Margaret of Anjou the Lancaster Queen who after losing both her husband and son in battle, was defeated by the House of York. She spent the last few years of her life living as a poor relation in the French court and died in penury. That would be my choice for Cersei but I think she will die. Qyburn do some sorcery to make her pregnant and if this so, it might be the means of her death.

I think that Tyrion will survive but I think his fate will be bittersweet. He will never win Daenerys’ love nor will be reunited with Sansa. He might betray Jon over Daenerys or to be reunited with his brother. He might take over his family’s fortunes but I suspect he will be alone at the end.

The casts has hinted that there will be many deaths during season eight and many battles. Martin mentioned that the story will end with a Game of Thrones version of the “Scouring of the Shire” which means there will be destruction and battles. I think the show will be more action driven rather than character driven as there are only six episodes and there will not be time to flesh out character driven subplots. I am guessing that most of the minor characters are doomed.

Euron Greyjoy and Theon Greyjoy will most likely die as will most minor characters. They are doomed and rather expendable. We have already seen the end of the Martells and the Tyrells as their part in the story has ended. Melisandre is going to die realizing that all she believed in will not happen. 

Yara Greyjoy might live long enough to rule the Iron Islands which would my choice for that character.

With Daenerys as Queen of Westeros and Sansa in charge of the North and Yara Greyjoy in charge of the Iron Islands … wouldn’t it be interesting if most of the rulers of Westeros turn out to be women?

I guess we will just have to wait to find out.
trail.content:
There are many articles being written lately about which character will be sitting on the Iron Throne at the end of the final season of Game of Thrones.

The most common opinion seems to be that either Daenerys Targaryen or Jon Snow will emerge victorious as the ruler of Westeros. This is the most obvious outcome. Others opinions are that it will be Gendry Waters, Sansa Stark or even Tyrion Lannister who will rule Westeros. George RR Martin only promises that the ending will be bittersweet meaning that there will be victories but no one will end up completely happy.

I think Daenerys will make it to the end of the story, but I think her fate is tied with her dragons rather than Jon or anyone else. If the dragons perish, she will die with her children. If the dragons defeat the Night King and his ice dragon and live, then she might be the Queen of Westeros and rule as the Dragon Queen. I think more likely she will die a heroic death. If she does have a child with Jon, this child might live to rule Westeros but with someone else as a regent.

Jon Snow sitting on the Iron Throne might be a possibility. The War of the Roses on which this story is based ended with Henry VII on the throne. He was a distant cousin of the Lancaster family and his ancestors were the illegitimate children of Owen Tudor and Catherine, Henry V’s widow. Henry VII’s marriage to York heiress Elizabeth ended the war. So Jon could be the outsider who claims the seven kingdoms as his own. After all, his mother was a Stark and his father was a Targaryen and the romance of his parents cast a long shadow over the story.

Of course this argument could be used for Gendry. After all he is the son of the late king. I don’t think that Gendry will end up on the Iron Throne, but I do think he will be the heir to the Crownlands.

Sam will make it to the end and possibly marry Gilly. Ok, that is what I dearly wish. Same deserves a win and I like them together. I see her as lady of Horn Hill. He will be there to be to write it all down. Perhaps he will be the hand of the next king. 

I have no guesses as to Bran Stark’s fate. I do not think that he will ever walk again nor be the Lord of Winterfell. It would be interesting to have a scene between him and Jaime. 

Sansa’s fate is a bit if mystery. The way she has presented in the story as a Katherine of York figure whose marriage might prove the political alliance to end the war. At the end of Feast of Crows she is still in the Vale and there was no horrific marriage to Ramsey Bolton. Nevertheless, in the published chapter of Winds of Winter, Littlefinger is pimping her out to Harry the Heir who does not appear in the series. In the books Ramsey marries and mistreats a minor character named Jeyne Poole who he thinks is Arya Stark. On the show Sansa has become the Lady of Winterfell and as an important heiress she will marry again to form an alliance but who would she marry? The poor girl has been engaged and married off twice. On possibility is Gendry, Jon is another, or she might go back to her first husband Tyrion. In the original outline for the books, the role of the romantic object of desire is actually Arya as Jon and Tyrion become rivals for her love but this role is now taken by Daenerys.  So I don’t think Sansa will marry Jon, Gendry or Tyrion. Sansa ending up in a relationship with the Hound is a possibility. This is hinted at in the books and this pairing has a considerable fandom. In the books Sansa and the Hound are deeply attracted to each other and he is never far from Sansa’s thoughts. If Sansa is a warg and Martin suggested that all the Stark children are wargs, The Hound is the person Sansa might be able to connect to. Unfortunately, the show runners have sidestepped that entire subplot and I am guessing that this might not happen on the show. My best guess is that Sansa will stay at Winterfell and remain its lady. They might leave the Hound with her as a protector but they won’t do a romance between them. That said the Winterfell she will preside over will be in ruin.

It goes without saying that The Hound will win Clegane Bowl. There will be riot in the streets if this does not happen. But he might take some pity on his brother when he realizes that Gregor was made into a monster by Cersei’s henchman Qyburn. That would be an interesting plot twist.

I heard about a story leak that there was a scene filmed where the Hound is driving a wagon out of Winterfell and Sansa and Arya are with them. Are they escaping the armies of the Night King? I guess we will have to wait to find out if this report is accurate.  This is a bit of wishful thinking bit for my fellow Sansan fans.

 Arya is a question. George RR Martin’s wife made him promise not to kill Arya off. I think Arya will remain alone and a warrior, but it might be that she has to pay for time with the faceless men. She might also defeat them. In the original outline, Martin planned to have Arya lose her taste for vengeance and eventually be with Jon when she realizes that he is not her brother. In my own fanfiction, I have Arya as the maiden aunt to Sansa and Sandor’s children but that is wishful thinking on my part.

I am convinced that Cersei and Jaime are doomed to die together as prophesized. Cersei is based on Margaret of Anjou the Lancaster Queen who after losing both her husband and son in battle, was defeated by the House of York. She spent the last few years of her life living as a poor relation in the French court and died in penury. That would be my choice for Cersei but I think she will die. Qyburn do some sorcery to make her pregnant and if this so, it might be the means of her death.

I think that Tyrion will survive but I think his fate will be bittersweet. He will never win Daenerys’ love nor will be reunited with Sansa. He might betray Jon over Daenerys or to be reunited with his brother. He might take over his family’s fortunes but I suspect he will be alone at the end.

The casts has hinted that there will be many deaths during season eight and many battles. Martin mentioned that the story will end with a Game of Thrones version of the “Scouring of the Shire” which means there will be destruction and battles. I think the show will be more action driven rather than character driven as there are only six episodes and there will not be time to flesh out character driven subplots. I am guessing that most of the minor characters are doomed.

Euron Greyjoy and Theon Greyjoy will most likely die as will most minor characters. They are doomed and rather expendable. We have already seen the end of the Martells and the Tyrells as their part in the story has ended. Melisandre is going to die realizing that all she believed in will not happen. 

Yara Greyjoy might live long enough to rule the Iron Islands which would my choice for that character.

With Daenerys as Queen of Westeros and Sansa in charge of the North and Yara Greyjoy in charge of the Iron Islands … wouldn’t it be interesting if most of the rulers of Westeros turn out to be women?

I guess we will just have to wait to find out.

summary: Rock Candy: Game of Thrones The Stark sisters are ready to do battle for their family as Rock Candy figures. Lady Sansa and Arya...
caption:
Rock Candy: Game of Thrones

The Stark sisters are ready to do battle for their family as Rock Candy figures. Lady Sansa and Arya might have very different personalities but that won’t stop them from fighting together for the House of Stark.
